required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bard LifeStent and Lutonix DCB for Treatment of Long Lesions in Femoropopliteal Arteries
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Multicenter, Single-Arm, Post-Market Study Using the Lutonix Drug Coated Balloon for Post-Dilatation of the Bard LifeStent Vascular Stent for Treatment of Long Lesions in Femoropopliteal Arteries

brief_summary.textblock: Objective of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of Lutonix 035 Drug Coated Dilatation PTA Catheter with Bard LifeStent Vascular Stent (hereinafter referred to as LifeStent) for treatment of long (10-24 cm) lesions in the SFA and/or proximal popliteal artery.

primary_outcome.measure: The primary efficacy endpoint is primary patency at 12 months. Primary patency is defined as the absence of target lesion restenosis and freedom from target lesion revascularization.
The primary safety endpoint is freedom from the composite endpoint of death, index limb amputation, and target vessel revascularization at 30 days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Procedural success, defined as attainment of ≤30% residual stenosis by quantitative angiography (QA) immediately after intervention in the absence of peri-procedural complications.
Technical success, defined as attainment of ≤30% residual stenosis by QA.
Device success, defined as successful delivery of device to target lesion and performance when used according to the clinical investigational plan.
Freedom from TLR after 30 days, and 6, 12 and 24 months post-index procedure.
Freedom from TVR after 30 days, and 6, 12 and 24 months post-index procedure.
Change in resting ankle brachial index (ABI) from baseline to 30 days, and 6, 12 and 24 months post-index procedure
Change in Rutherford Classification from baseline to 30 days, and 6, 12 and 24 months post-index procedure
Target limb reintervention for treatment of thrombosis of target vessel or embolization to its distal vasculature

intervention.description: Subject will receive treatment with the Lutonix Drug Coated Balloon
